channel.title: nlin.PS updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: nlin.PS updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Polar core vortex dynamics in disc-trapped homogeneous spin-1 Bose-Einstein condensates
item.description: arXiv:2510.25139v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We study the dynamics of polar core vortices in the easy plane phase of an atomic spin-1 Bose-Einstein condensate confined in a two-dimensional disc potential. A single vortex moves radially outward due to its interaction with background flows that arise from boundary effects. Pairs of opposite sign vortices, which tend to attract, move either radially inward or outward, depending on their strength of attraction relative to boundary effects. Pairs of same sign vortices repel. Spiral vortex dynamics are obtained for same-sign pairs in the presence of a finite axial magnetization. We quantify the dynamics for a range of realistic experimental parameters, finding that the vortex dynamics are accelerated with increasing quadratic Zeeman energy, consistent with existing studies in planar systems.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Edmonds, Lewis A. Williamson, Matthew J. Davis
